sentence.Network_en: I began to nauseate the place I was in.
sentence.Network_cn: 我开始厌恶我所住的地方.

sentence.Network_en: He was afraid that it might nauseate him and he would vomit and lose his strength.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怕这肉会使他恶心,弄得他呕吐,丧失力气.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin nauseat- 'made to feel sick', from the verb nauseare, from nausea (see nausea)

entry.def: If something nauseates you, it makes you feel as if you are going to vomit.

example.ex: The smell of frying nauseated her...
She could not eat anything without feeling nauseated.

sentences.sentence: "The smell of the foood turned the pregnant woman's stomach"
"The mold ont he food sickened the diners"

means.word_mean: 2. cause aversion in; offend the moral sense of;

auth_sentence.content: Researchers are trying to make a flashlight that would enable police to disorient or nauseate somebody they are trying to catch.
